fields.caption: Penn Station on Friday. The derailment of a New Jersey Transit train last Monday snarled commutes for the rest of the workweek.
A ferry leaving Hoboken Terminal for Manhattan on Wednesday. New York Waterway added ferries to alleviate some of the commuting woes.
Commuters last week heading for the ferry in Hoboken, left, and on a Manhattan-bound PATH train, right.
Amtrak, New Jersey Transit and the Long Island Rail Road transport half a million people through Penn Station every weekday.
